body_html:
I got the same error when trying to install TensorFlow with a Python installation that was not the default one on the system. Adding the desired version to the path solved the issue, e.g. with:

PATH=~/tensorflow-0.12.0-nogpu/bin:$PATH
export PATH

In my case, I was using python 3 and there was no file in my /bin folder that was just called python, so I added a symlink:

ln -s ~/tensorflow-0.12.0-nogpu/bin/python3.5 ~/tensorflow-0.12.0-nogpu/bin/python
body_text:
I got the same error when trying to install TensorFlow with a Python installation that was not the default one on the system. Adding the desired version to the path solved the issue, e.g. with:
PATH=~/tensorflow-0.12.0-nogpu/bin:$PATH
export PATH

In my case, I was using python 3 and there was no file in my /bin folder that was just called python, so I added a symlink:
ln -s ~/tensorflow-0.12.0-nogpu/bin/python3.5 ~/tensorflow-0.12.0-nogpu/bin/python
body:
I got the same error when trying to install TensorFlow with a Python installation that was not the default one on the system. Adding the desired version to the path solved the issue, e.g. with:
```
PATH=~/tensorflow-0.12.0-nogpu/bin:$PATH
export PATH
```

In my case, I was using python 3 and there was no file in my /bin folder that was just called `python`, so I added a symlink:
```
ln -s ~/tensorflow-0.12.0-nogpu/bin/python3.5 ~/tensorflow-0.12.0-nogpu/bin/python
```
